chunks.original_text: 有女及姅，不可不嫁。 有男及事，不可不婚。 今朝既相证，他日记深恩。 主人住，客即去，心意悬悬。 八九日来长闭户，今朝始得乍开门。 是时也，礼已备。 乐过时，亲族散，妇人归，唯男与女，独自依依。 如日与月，历劫相随。 此之一法，道之根基。 非圣贤之莫测，非神明之莫知。 唯我与师子悦得之，切宜密行。 密行不失，与道不离。 勿令三泄，勿使五知。 若当如是与道，秘之秘之，如此不可思议。 逍遥子曰：曾在玄，雄在虎，可怜金木水火土。 其中有个白头翁，终朝指示青天路。 有绿至士若逢之，努力殷勤好收取。 又曰：有道可传扬，秘即天道昌。 欲得长寿者，孝顺阿耶娘。 峨眉窦真人九转诗 岩叟承恩宠，烧丹在禁闱。 釜中诸药化，炉上水银飞。 璧合秋霜＇色，光含夜月辉。 总由明主感，能使道精微。 却取抽成汞，还烧遣作砂。 上仙方秘密，中禁药精华。 紫黑含真色，朱光杂晓霞。 欲将同一体，须更猛三花。 转转穷微妙，重重入杳冥。 由将药砂体，部变水银形。 黑合秋霜静，朱光夜落星。 自然成诧女，何虑不通灵。 白锡虽初化，黄芽制已凝。 元如天降雪，映似结池冰。 研土乾和炒，罗灰湿拌蒸。 仍须看黑色。 更待卤咸澄。 文武长调火，阴阳镇作炉。 釜中看黑过，锅裹定真虚。 炬石重缭养，防非六药涂。 已坚如合璧，何处觅流珠。 硝石临汤沃，碉砂浸水煎。 咸赢只是转，矾细不须研。 旧白初凝硬，新黄色未坚。 欲将持入火，由怯水银烟。 罢火开丹鳌，成金去药泥。 瑞光连日月，真气杂虹蜕。 形胜参金鼎，精华向马蹄。 由须九转毕，看取一刀圭。 化粉初研炼，临炉定否臧。 似尘惊半紫，如缅讶全黄。 瑞作三茎穗，灵含五色光。 待抽金毒尽，特献玉阶傍。 玉律春初至，金丹帝感成。 南山同圣寿，束海比时清。 福是玄元德，功由至道呈。 小臣虽有术，仙士谢茅盈。 青城罗真人上明皇白金小还丹歌 帝问真人日：道本无二，同归乎一。 药有多功，身宁济惠。 愿垂悯念，速救余生。 真人曰： 身在和黑，药同元滋，二道符机，衰朽自差。 莫希大药，日月难期。 一味白金，延年益寿， 仙人保秘，不妄虚传，但能秘之，无轻泄尔。 凡一十二首， 法药变化，无非水精，六芝润色，黄芽自生，阳光不起，阴流无声，道方秘易，学者难成。 既养黄男，先禁家鬼。 尽死扶金，余生制水。 世人能明，并穷斯理。 亲奉圣言，事难自揣。 笼虚其底，免被炎驰。 知白守黑，清黄一支。 能忌阴秽，不逾百时。 延生大道，易解难知。 黄子淳淑，自娶玄妃。 金成力厚，药就身肥。 土宅三分，火房二仪。 至德消阴，纯阳幽微。 一味白金，固人衰朽。 杂性难防，同心易守。 服食千粒，百日无咎。 万病渐除，天年地寿。 言依口诀，亲贵乎传。 七日自伏，万刻牢坚。 千炼万煮，托在五贤。 好蕴金器，不绝玄关。 赭涂四壁，丹守圆扉。 一居火匮，二处灰池。 五蟾可保，三乌无疑。 道情未速，益日加奇。 一黄二白，三铢两作。 养至满蟾，生其高鹤。 事忌他非，道身自乐。 传受非人，天殃地虐。 芽属黄男，药在玄女。 外助无非，玉芝清醋。 俗士多闻，道君少语。 用物参差，虚受辛苦。 铜铁坏形，丹灰损力。 欲验其神，须存本色。 一阴一阳，事易候则。
chunks.translated_text:
Girls who reach marriageable age must be wed,
Boys who come of age must take a wife.
Today we bear witness to this union,
In days to come, remember this deep kindness.
The host remains, the guests depart,
Their hearts still lingering, suspended in longing.
For eight or nine days the door stayed shut,
Only today was it first flung open.
At this moment, rites are complete.
The music has passed its time, kinfolk disperse,
The bride returns to her chamber—
Only the man and woman remain,
Clinging to each other in tender reluctance.
Like sun and moon,
They follow each other through kalpas unending.
This is the one method,
The root and foundation of the Dao.
Not even sages and worthies can fathom it,
Nor gods and spirits comprehend.
Only my master and I have grasped it—
Guard it closely, practice it in secret.
Keep it hidden without fail,
And you will never stray from the Dao.
Let no triple leak occur,
Nor the five know of it.
If you hold to this and the Dao,
Keep it secret, secret—
Such wonders are beyond thought.

Master Xiaoyao says:
Once hidden in mystery, now fierce as a tiger,
Pity the Five Agents—Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth.
Yet within them dwells a white-haired elder,
Pointing the way to the azure sky all day long.
If a scholar of the Dao should meet him,
Exert every effort to cherish and grasp this truth.

He also says:
The Dao may be transmitted,
But if kept secret, Heaven’s Way flourishes.
Those who seek long life,
Honor and obey father and mother.

**Ode on the Nine Cycles of the Yellow Lady of Mount Emei**
The old hermit, favored by grace,
Refines the elixir within the forbidden chamber.
In the crucible, all medicines transform,
Above the furnace, mercury takes flight.
Like autumn frost in hue, the jade unites,
Its radiance holding the moon’s nightly glow.
All arises from the Enlightened Lord’s inspiration,
Enabling the Dao’s subtleties to unfold.

First, draw forth the mercury,
Then burn it back into cinnabar.
The method of the immortals is most secret,
The essence of alchemy in the inner court.
Purple-black bears the true color,
Crimson light mingles with dawn’s rosy clouds.
To merge into one body,
One must fiercely refine the Three Flowers.
Cycle upon cycle, delving into the profound,
Layer upon layer, entering the boundless void.
The cinnabar’s body now shifts,
Returning to mercury’s form.
Black as autumn frost, still,
Crimson light like stars at dusk.
Naturally it becomes the marvelous maiden—
What fear is there of failing to attain the numinous?

Though white tin first melts,
The yellow sprout has already congealed.
Like snow descending from heaven,
Or ice forming on a pool’s surface.
Grind the dry earth and stir-fry,
Sift the ash and steam with moisture.
Still, watch for the black hue,
Then wait for the brine to settle.
Regulate the fire with civil and martial balance,
Seal the furnace with yin and yang.
In the crucible, observe the black pass,
In the pot, discern true emptiness.
Reinforce with repeated nurturing,
Guard against the six medicines’ corruption.
Once hardened like joined jade,
Where can one find a straying pearl?

Niter poured into boiling water,
Borax steeped in simmering brew.
Salt’s excess merely transforms,
Alum’s fine grains need no grinding.
Old white hardens at first,
New yellow’s hue not yet firm.
Before placing it in the fire,
Fear the mercury’s fumes.
Cease the fire, open the elixir’s cauldron,
Refine the gold, remove the medicinal mud.
Auspicious light joins sun and moon,
True qi mingles with rainbow’s sheen.
Its form excels the golden tripod,
Its essence gathers toward the horse’s hoof.
Only after nine cycles are complete,
Behold the single *dao* knife’s measure.

Ground to powder, refined anew,
Test its worth before the furnace.
Like dust, half-purple startles the eye,
Like silk, all-yellow evokes wonder.
Auspicious as three stalks of grain,
Numinous with five-colored light.
Wait until the gold’s poison is fully drawn,
Then present it beside the jade steps.

When the jade pitchpipe heralds spring’s return,
The golden elixir responds to the Emperor’s devotion.
May the Southern Mountains share the Sage’s longevity,
The Eastern Sea match the age’s purity.
Blessings flow from the Mysterious Origin’s virtue,
Merit arises from the Supreme Dao’s manifestation.
Though this humble servant possesses the art,
The immortal transcends the thatched hut’s bounds.

**Song of the Lesser Return Elixir of White Metal**
The Emperor asked the Perfected One:
"The Dao is fundamentally without duality,
All converging in the One.
Medicines have many functions,
Yet how can the body be aided and blessed?
I beg your compassion,
Hasten to save my life."

The Perfected One replied:
"Body in harmony with the black,
Medicine sharing the primordial essence—
The two Dao align with the mechanism,
And decrepitude naturally recedes.
Do not seek the great elixir,
For sun and moon’s timing is hard to await.
A single taste of white metal
Prolongs life and augments years.
The immortals guard this secret,
Never transmitting it lightly.
If you can keep it hidden,
Do not lightly disclose it."

In all twelve verses,
The transformations of medicines and methods
Are none other than water’s essence.
The Six Fungi lend their hues,
The yellow sprout grows naturally.
Yang’s light does not rise,
Yin’s flow makes no sound.
The Dao’s method is secret yet simple,
Yet scholars find it hard to achieve.

First nurture the yellow youth,
Begin by restraining the household ghosts.
Exhaust death to support metal,
Let remaining life restrain water.
If one can grasp this principle,
All will penetrate its truth.
Receive the Sage’s words in person,
For the matter is hard to fathom alone.

Hollow the base to avoid scorching,
Know the white, guard the black,
Refine the yellow into one branch.
Avoid yin’s filth,
And within a hundred days,
The great Dao of longevity—
Easy to understand, hard to know.

The Yellow Lad, pure and refined,
Weds the Mysterious Consort.
Gold’s power grows strong,
The medicine matures, the body flourishes.
The earthen dwelling holds three parts,
The fire chamber embodies the Two Modes.
Supreme virtue dissolves yin,
Pure yang abides in subtlety.
A single taste of white metal
Fortifies human decrepitude.
Mixed natures are hard to guard,
But shared resolve is easy to maintain.
Consume a thousand grains,
And for a hundred days, no harm will come.
Ten thousand illnesses gradually fade,
Heaven’s years, Earth’s longevity.

Follow the oral instructions,
Cherish the transmission in person.
After seven days, it naturally subdues,
Ten thousand moments, firmly secured.
Refined a thousand times, boiled ten thousand,
Entrusted to the Five Worthies.
Store it well in a golden vessel,
Never sever the Mysterious Pass.
Daub the four walls with ochre,
Guard the cinnabar at the round door.
One resides in the fire’s coffer,
Two in the ash pit.
Five toads can be preserved,
Three crows, no doubt.
The Dao’s essence unfolds slowly,
Each day growing more wondrous.

One yellow, two white,
Three *zhu*, two made.
Nurture until the toad is full,
Raise the lofty crane.
Avoid other distractions,
The Dao and body will naturally rejoice.
Transmit to the unworthy,
And heaven’s calamity, earth’s cruelty will follow.

The sprout belongs to the Yellow Lad,
The medicine resides in the Mysterious Maiden.
External aids are none other than
Jade fungi and pure vinegar.
Vulgar scholars hear much,
Dao Lords speak little.
Discrepancies in materials
Bring vain suffering.
Copper and iron mar the form,
Cinnabar ash saps strength.
To verify its numinous power,
One must preserve its original nature.

One yin, one yang—
The matter is easy, the timing is the key.

chunks.original_text: 异族同群，自种刻棘。 杀青龙，须白虎，自然感化无风雨。 雪花飞。 雪花飞，魂归魄已归， 聚散既由壬癸水，玉神华盖体无为。 涌泉水，涌泉水，春夏秋冬深无底。 要行天下时，厚暖自然制。 太白韩蕴中火记歌 夫大道弘远，阴阳难穷。 造化发生，世人莫测。 妄谈虚而白首，谬制作以亡财，比求延命驻年，反却伤伐短寿。 古今好者，过丧亿人。 例抱乖非，不明宗旨，及临炉火，尽炼朱砂抽汞，称阴对於黄石，或将铅而入汞，或飞汞而入流，或炼土而言金，或乌乳而为蜜，销铅投汞，称是黄芽，汞入庚辛，呼为龙虎，汞为大道咸尽非，心若为利而可亲，夫为丹而大谬。 余积岁好道，不悟真元，如斯制伏，皆亲历试。 见世人之疫毙，深切哀伤，观生死之倏尔，何处访道。 故述要妙，将显学流，细详阴阳，总愿悟道。 夫铅者，坎中之男，正属壬癸，炼阴销烁，九转浮沉，数足成乾，故配西位。 世人常见，不晓真元。 虎亦现形，为刚利黑，上腾天而为云雨，下降地而为泉源，玉质九还，金公灭火，全由白雪也。 夫汞者，离中之女，正属丙丁，万物滋荣，皆受其黑，上应青阳而有信，下隐白藏而潜沈，龙腾天而见木精，春发来而花药卉，朦胧恍惚，只在目前，七返还魂，妙花碧水。 若以省悟，玄奥皆明。 瞑目之流，难为眺望也。 是以月中之魄虎，炼曦和日中之魂龙，伏桂影二黑，相感结为夫妻。 坎在三华，成为至理。 故彰要妙，以示知音。 兼咏天符十三首，后学详览，必契真元。 若获此文，请不妄泄也。 复始才阳发，循环顺节移。 龙潜腾未得，虎伏叫声希。 二黑相方会！ 三花兆启期。 火盈临九数，亏折却来归。 二九临炉日，乾坤气正交。 金童来克木，土镇水胎胞。 感应相吞瞰，和同在意调。 进时加刻漏，退即卦依爻。 道泰亲承候，阳和始发生。 律移□ 孟月，斗建守寅行。 君子心乾惕，阴阳顺节萌。 三旬终出户，梼治再还烹。 榆死魁临卯，三无正是时。 日魂和月魄，此两精合为大道也。 龙虎自相持。 大壮成规矩，花开向桂枝。 罢炉停火候，青色转光辉。 万木尽含阳，花开满路香。 金鸡乘大火，朱火精。 玉兔却亏伤。 水精。 至士忧生死，尊卑倏忽亡。 药成朝大帝，服饵灭灾殃。 苦节炼成乾，修丹在志坚。 虎伤龙带血，金杀木无烟。 阳盛阴将至，荣来衰自然。 击声同磬响，观视得延年。 初六到南宫，阴升娠启蒙。 刻频移律吕，持节递相攻。 五日才亏折，三花运数供。 取来临户看，血点几千重。 小吉柄天符，阴来遁积孚。 金公赓筋髓，朱乌握机枢。 道体同天地，冲和药在炉。 莫将为变化，服饵死皆苏。 否闭三阴降，将军杀黑多。 牵牛星汉会，织女渡天河。 甲乙变伤木，庚辛剑始磨。 令行巡节候，寒暑总经过。 月合天刚至，风生荠麦芽。 土公亲祭祀，涎坛养金砂。 桂影圆霄汉，曦和韵紫霞。 鸿来玄乌去，将见水中植。 冷黑伤时物，阴来万木凋。 菊花寻戊己，赤血斩龙腰。 剥烂将为土，离铅见即消。 苦心修至道，莫恨路迢迢。 上六居坤位，阴阳括始终。 帝男业作髓，离女血殷红。 二八当交合，三人义不同。 开炉看至宝，服即变衰翁。 重历纯元地，阳潜造六寒。 三旬攻荐至，六九始成丹。 金膀书名字，仙宫立醮坛。
chunks.translated_text:
Within strange clans, they herd as one,
Each kind sharpens its own thorns.
To slay the Green Dragon, summon the White Tiger—
Naturally transformed, no wind nor rain.
Snowflakes fly.
Snowflakes fly, the soul returns, the spirit already home,
Gathering and scattering both ruled by the waters of *ren* and *gui*.
Beneath the Jade Canopy’s radiant bloom, the body abides in non-action.

Bubbling Spring’s waters,
Bubbling Spring’s waters—
Through spring, summer, autumn, winter, depth without end.
When the time comes to traverse the world,
Thick warmth naturally governs.

*Tai Bai Han Yun Zhong Huo Ji Ge*
The Great Dao is vast and boundless,
Yin and yang beyond fathoming.
Creation’s unfolding, generation’s arising—
The world’s people cannot perceive.
Foolishly discoursing on emptiness, they age with white hair;
Erroneously crafting, they squander their wealth.
Seeking to prolong life and halt the years,
They instead wound and shorten their span.
From ancient times to now, those who have loved this path
Have brought ruin to countless lives.
Grasping at misguided methods, ignorant of the true aim,
When facing the furnace’s fire, they merely refine cinnabar to draw mercury,
Matching yin to yellow stone,
Or adding lead to mercury,
Or flying mercury into streams,
Or refining earth to claim gold,
Or mistaking crow’s milk for honey.
Melting lead into mercury, they call it "Yellow Sprout";
Mercury entering *geng* and *xin*, they name it "Dragon and Tiger."
Mercury as the Great Dao—all is false.
If the heart is moved by profit, how can it be embraced?
To forge the elixir is a grave error.

I, having long loved the Dao, failed to awaken to the true origin.
Such methods of subjugation—
All were personally tested.
Witnessing the world’s people perish from plague,
I felt deep sorrow and grief.
Observing life and death’s fleeting passage,
Where could one seek the Dao?
Thus, I set forth these essential mysteries,
To reveal them to fellow learners.
I meticulously detail yin and yang,
Hoping all may awaken to the Dao.

Now, lead is the male within *kan*,
Rightly belonging to *ren* and *gui*.
Refining yin to dissolve and smelt,
Nine cycles of floating and sinking—
When the count is complete, it becomes *qian*,
Thus paired with the western position.
The world’s people see it often,
Yet do not comprehend its true origin.

The Tiger, too, manifests its form,
Fierce, sharp, and black.
Ascending to heaven, it becomes clouds and rain;
Descending to earth, it becomes springs and sources.
Its jade essence returns nine times,
The Metal Elder extinguishes fire—
All through the White Snow.

Mercury is the female within *li*,
Rightly belonging to *bing* and *ding*.
All things flourish and thrive,
Receiving its darkness.
Above, it responds to the Azure Yang with constancy;
Below, it hides in the White Storehouse, sinking in concealment.
The Dragon soars to heaven, revealing the essence of wood;
Spring’s arrival brings forth flowers and herbs.
Vague and indistinct, yet right before the eyes—
Seven returns to revive the soul,
Mysterious blossoms and azure waters.
If one awakens to this,
All profound secrets become clear.
Those who close their eyes
Will find it hard to glimpse.

Thus, the Tiger of the moon’s dark phase,
Refining the Dragon of the sun’s radiant essence,
Subduing the shadows of the twin blacks,
They mutually attract and unite as husband and wife.
*Kan* resides in the Three Flowers,
Becoming the ultimate principle.
Therefore, I reveal these essential mysteries
To those who would understand.

I also chant the *Thirteen Celestial Talismans*—
Let later learners study them closely,
And they will surely grasp the true origin.
If you obtain this text,
Do not recklessly disclose it.

The returning yang begins to stir,
Following the cycle, the seasons shift.
The Dragon lurks, unable to soar,
The Tiger crouches, its cries rare.
The two blacks meet at last!
The Three Flowers foretell the dawn.
Fire fills the ninefold count,
Then wanes and returns again.

On the eighteenth day before the furnace,
Heaven and earth’s qi intermingle.
The Metal Youth comes to restrain wood,
Earth stabilizes the water’s embryonic sac.
Resonance and response mutually consume and gaze,
Harmony and unity lie in attunement.
Advance with the measured dripping,
Retreat according to the hexagram’s lines.

When the Dao prospers, await the proper moment,
Yang’s harmony begins to arise.
The pitch shifts in the first month,
The Dipper’s handle guards *yin*’s course.
The nobleman’s heart remains vigilant,
Yin and yang follow the seasonal sprouts.
After thirty days, step forth,
Pray and refine, then return to the fire.

The Elm’s death, the *Kui* star nears *mao*—
The third absence marks the right time.
The sun’s essence and moon’s spirit,
These two essences unite to form the Great Dao.
Dragon and Tiger naturally contend.
Great Strength completes the compass and square,
Blossoms open toward the cassia branches.
Cease the furnace, halt the fire’s timing,
The azure hue transforms into radiant light.

All trees contain yang,
Blossoms open, fragrance fills the path.
The Golden Rooster rides the great fire,
The Vermilion Fire’s essence.
The Jade Hare wanes and is harmed,
The Water’s essence.
The wise grieve over life and death,
High and low vanish in an instant.
When the medicine is complete, pay homage to the Great Emperor,
Ingesting it dispels calamities.

Through bitter discipline, *qian* is refined,
Cultivating the elixir requires steadfast resolve.
If the Tiger wounds the Dragon, blood flows,
If metal slays wood, no smoke rises.
When yang flourishes, yin approaches,
Prosperity gives way to decline naturally.
Strike the sound, let it ring like a chime,
Observe and gain extended years.

At *Chu Liu*, reaching the southern palace,
Yin ascends, pregnancy begins.
The pitch pipes shift frequently,
Holding the nodes, they alternately attack.
After five days, the count wanes,
The Three Flowers’ fate is supplied.
Bring it to the door to see—
Bloodstains, thousands deep.

*Xiao Ji* wields the celestial talisman,
Yin comes, retreating in accumulated trust.
The Metal Elder replenishes marrow and sinew,
The Vermilion Bird grasps the pivotal mechanism.
The Dao’s body mirrors heaven and earth,
The harmonious medicine resides in the furnace.
Do not treat it as mere transformation—
Ingesting it, even the dead revive.

When *Pi* closes, the three yins descend,
The general slays the many blacks.
The Herdboy meets the Weaving Maiden at the Celestial River.
*Jia* and *yi* injure wood,
*Geng* and *xin* begin to sharpen the sword.
Commands circulate through the seasonal nodes,
Cold and heat all pass through.
When the moon aligns with heaven’s hardness,
Wind stirs the shepherd’s purse and wheat sprouts.
The Earth Lord personally conducts the sacrifice,
The saliva altar nurtures golden sand.

The cassia’s shadow rounds the Milky Way,
The sun’s harmony rhymes with purple clouds.
The swan arrives, the dark crow departs—
Soon, one will see plants growing in water.
Cold yin harms the season’s beings,
Yin’s arrival withers all trees.
Seek chrysanthemums at *wu* and *ji*,
Crimson blood severs the Dragon’s waist.
Decaying into earth,
When lead is separated, it vanishes.
With a steadfast heart, cultivate the ultimate Dao,
Do not resent the distant path.

At *Shang Liu*, dwelling in *kun*’s position,
Yin and yang encompass the beginning and end.
The Emperor’s son’s work becomes marrow,
The *Li* maiden’s blood is deep red.
When two and eight unite,
The three differ in principle.
Open the furnace to behold the supreme treasure—
Ingesting it, the withered elder transforms.

Revisiting the land of pure origin,
Yang hides, creating the six colds.
After thirty days of refinement,
The nine-six elixir is complete.
Inscribe the name on the golden tablet,
Erect the altar in the immortal’s palace.

chunks.original_text: 厌离人世患，羽化去乘鸾。 盐胆米，左味煮帝男帝女，三日三夜，左味调黄作匮，养一七日也。 杨行真人歌 世上人人总爱药，个个元来寻不着。 也道用铅不用铅，及至用铅还只错。 寻不着，莫生瞋，都为黄芽不得真。 有信有行堪分付，财色不染是真人。 潜拯济，莫彰露，本觅长生却短祚。 慎勿将身游贵门，医卜经求且闲处。 未能隐，没闲处，且去经求无病药，长生乐道何忧虑。 铅为君，汞为臣，火为使者。 赤血将军，守阴守阳，制御伏药。 药成先用点水银，水银被点堪服饵，鬼官不追人不死，世世喧喧若得之，闲处经求莫干贵。 心口诀，手眼传，制伏只在黄芽边。 心口不次，手眼不传，耽荒酒色，与道无绿。 丹田水结黄芽起，百日养来伏火矣。 阴居阳鼎是金丹，十月养之堪服饵。 服饵由来驻颜色，容鬓不衰定心力。 卖丹卖药住人间，寿命千年人不识。 长生药，不死丹，世人欲作寻复难。 心犹豫，意迟疑，八丹方法由来有，如何不取一门知。 二人语，共商量，日夜寻思不死方。 若取黑铅并姥女，腾身天上自翱翔。 一为左，一为右，阴阳具足还丹就。 真须炼，必长生，逍遥自在紫蕾买庭。 世上喧喧车马人，红颜绿鬓不长春。 药术相传万甲子，学者忙忙寻不真。 若交个个识黄芽，世问那得有贫人。 老翁老婆造大药，铅汞二金用不错。 出汤入火少精神，半生半死相依约。 依约由来一甲子，上阴下阳相伏矣。 世上喧喧若得之，鬼官不收免生死。 铅是铅，汞是汞，世上人人总能用。 草黄芽，木黄芽，世上人人总馒夸。 自古口传不形纸，烧者徒劳尽破家。 西方白帝居武都，裹有鹦冠众所须。 华池固济经七日，妮女因媒寻得夫。 看炉切候四时黑，冷暖寒温心不寐。 供养仙人礼度周，一点黄金应满地。 铅汞二阴，还丹之心。 相制不难，人迷不寻。 学者不见，徒费千金。 堪得指教，作福拯贫。 如斯之用，天人不瞋。 非道破除，天之大怒。 恶病加之，遭官刑狱。 黑类不同居，母子相依约。 不得铅黄芽，制伏还不着。 黄芽阴中伏，白雪阳中作。 将入火中烧。 阴阳相系缚。 母子不能逃，生死不离却。 丹砂丹砂，济命济家。 能济我命，能济我家。 能生诧女，嫁与黄芽。 事夫洁素，无喜无怒。 礼乐周旋，晨昏节度。 金亦可作，世亦可度，作金不成，徒然自俟。 汞结本在丹田中，次居阳鼎黑相通。 和合三朝方始住，还知大药在铅中。 先入阴炉成大白，后居阳鼎变金丹。 世人若达其中理，水银被制不为难。 朱砂水银入铅池，收得黄芽人不知。 本是仙人留口诀，有绿相遇还要师。 师须分明传口诀，世上喧喧少言说。 七十年中付一人，分明还须有仙骨。 世上求道，酒肉愚痴，百年欲过，显显不知。 金公制伏，还丹一支。 朱砂伏火，治病无疑。 长生有望，坚固无疑。 不一哀不老，彭祖同时。 古仙取得赤铜精，一两水银一两精。 炮砂半两浆水煎，从朝至暮体能坚。 入铜入铁铸镜力，鬼神怕惧不能言。 若得至人留口诀，事须保爱始长年。 阳精若坚魂自立，阴精若坚魄自成。 魂魄坚强心有圣，红铅朱汞更能灵。 得遇仙公留此术，魂神魄立自长生。 能知少女，必定还精。 能伏朱儿，必定坚贞。 金精石髓，是魂之灵。 能修者圣，能伏者灵，鬼官不追，仙籍有名。
chunks.translated_text:
Renouncing the world’s afflictions, one ascends on wings to ride the simurgh.
Salt, gallbladder, and rice—boil the Emperor’s son and daughter with left-flavored herbs for three days and nights. Left-flavored herbs blend with yellow to form a vessel, nurtured for one seven-day cycle.

*Song of Perfected Yang Xing:*
All in the world love elixirs,
Yet none truly find them.
Some say use lead, some say not—
Even when lead is used, it is still wrong.
If you cannot find it, do not grow angry;
It is because the true Yellow Sprout eludes you.
Only those with faith and conduct are worthy of transmission—
Those unstained by wealth or lust are true adepts.

Work in secret to aid others, never flaunt your skill,
For seeking immortality may instead shorten your years.
Beware of wandering among the halls of the noble;
Leave divination and healing to idle hands.
If you cannot yet retreat, with no place of leisure,
Then seek remedies for illness—
Why fret over the joy of the Dao and long life?

Lead is the sovereign, mercury the minister,
Fire the messenger.
The Crimson Blood General guards yin and yang,
Commanding and subduing the medicine.
When the elixir is complete, first use it to refine mercury—
Once mercury is transmuted, it may be ingested.
No ghostly officials will pursue you, nor will you die.
If you attain this, seek it in quietude, not among the powerful.

The secret lies in the heart, transmitted through hand and eye.
If heart and mouth do not align, if hand and eye are not passed down,
Indulging in wine and lust severs all ties to the Dao.
When water in the Cinnabar Field congeals, the Yellow Sprout arises;
After a hundred days of nurturing, it submits to fire.
Yin dwelling in the yang crucible is the Golden Elixir—
After ten months of refinement, it is ready for ingestion.
Ingesting it preserves your complexion,
Your hair and temples never wither, your resolve never falters.
Selling elixirs and medicines among men,
A thousand years of life go unrecognized.

The elixir of long life, the pill of immortality—
The world desires them, yet they are hard to find.
Hesitant in heart, wavering in intent,
The eight methods of elixir-making have long existed—
Why not master even one?

Two converse, plotting together,
Day and night seeking the formula of immortality.
If you obtain black lead and the Old Woman,
You will soar into the heavens on your own wings.
One is left, one is right—
When yin and yang are complete, the Returned Elixir is achieved.
Truly refine it, and you will surely live long,
Roaming freely in the purple courtyards of the immortals.

The world’s bustling crowds, with their carriages and horses,
Their rosy cheeks and black hair do not endure.
Alchemical arts have been passed down for ten thousand years,
Yet seekers rush about, never finding the truth.
If everyone recognized the Yellow Sprout,
How could there be poverty in the world?

Old men and women craft the great medicine—
Lead and mercury, the two metals, are not misused.
Emerging from water, entering fire, they lose vitality,
Half-alive, half-dead, bound in mutual accord.
Through this accord, a sixty-year cycle is completed—
Above yin, below yang, they submit to one another.
If you attain this in the world’s clamor,
No ghostly officials will claim you, sparing you from death.

Lead is lead, mercury is mercury—
Yet all in the world think they can use them.
The Yellow Sprout of herbs, the Yellow Sprout of wood—
All in the world boast of them idly.
Since ancient times, secrets were passed mouth to ear, never written—
Those who burn offerings labor in vain, ruining their families.

The White Emperor of the West dwells in Wu Du,
Adorned with a parrot-feathered crown, as all require.
The Flowery Pond is sealed for seven days—
The maid, through a matchmaker, finds her husband.
Watch the furnace closely, tending to the four seasons’ darkness;
Cold and warmth, heat and chill—do not let your heart sleep.
Honor the immortals with perfect ritual—
A single drop of yellow gold fills the earth.

Lead and mercury, the two yin,
Are the heart of the Returned Elixir.
Their mutual restraint is not difficult,
Yet people remain lost, never seeking.
Scholars see nothing, wasting a thousand gold pieces.
If you receive guidance, you create blessings and relieve poverty.
Such is its use—
Neither heaven nor immortals will resent you.
If you recklessly reveal the Dao,
Heaven’s wrath will be great.
Plagues will strike, and you will face official punishment.

Black kinds do not dwell together—
Mother and child are bound in mutual accord.
Without lead and the Yellow Sprout,
Subjugation is impossible.
The Yellow Sprout submits within yin,
White Snow arises within yang.
Placed into the fire to burn,
Yin and yang are bound together.
Mother and child cannot escape,

Cinnabar subdues fire,

Long life is within reach,
Unshakably firm.

chunks.original_text: 《参》云：状若明窗尘也。 铅汞一门不可依，金丹秘说圣无知。 此秘圣道，无人知之，世人呼盐为圣，无知也。 莫将世上凡金石，论年运火竞相持。 若将世上几铅汞，修炼无益也。 天生此物应虚无， 此物应微妙之熙结成，非造作结而成也。 为妻为子复为夫。 此药如君如臣，如母如子，如夫如妻，如鱼如水也。 三五之门唯日月，分明卯酉坐为初。 若人知三五，终身无忧。 若卯酉是长生之位也。 阳界所生，阴熙坐位也。 乾坤不得相违避，至事元归在天地。 天地是大道也，世人日用不知也。 十月怀胎母子分，贤者何曾更连弃。 言其转数终，炼灵药迥然，弃母而子独居，故贤者何曾连弃。 含养天然禀至真，冲和之黑结成身。 《参》云：天生玄女，地产黄男。 富贵总绿怀五彩，岂将铅汞共相亲。 此物含受五行正熙，今人呼胡铅是也。 玄黄冥漠不可辩， 世人不识铅汞也。 铅汞之门义难显。 言世人不识阴阳也。 世人不晓定其元，细视五行君自见。 言五行者，金木水火土是也。 婴儿遑遑不可悟，徒自劳神虚见苦。 世人不识灵妙之要，虚劳神思，不见其效也。 但知会取圣人言，分明即是上天路。 三五同居共一室， 龙虎号三五也。 一夫二妻为偶匹。 一二者，水火数，土五也。 要假良媒方得亲，遂使交游情意密。 阴阳之道，须得良媒，良媒者神水也。 若得良媒，夫妻自然和合也。 阴阳冥漠不可知，青龙白虎自相持。 龙虎入室，而不可解也。 年终变转相吞瞰，白虎制龙龙渐稀。 年终转数毕矣，似能别汞渐乾成宝也。 乾天为阳坤老母， 言一阴一阳谓之道也。 南方朱雀北玄武。 南方火神，北方水神。 年终岁久俱作土，时人何处寻龙虎。 水火俱成土也。 三人义合共为宗， 三人者，鼎三足。 常钦日月照其中。 日月二熙，入於鼎中死也。 已遇三花今再液，九转能终岁月功。 九转者，阳数极尽。 三花者，火也。 青龙本质时言东， 东方甲乙木，汞也，震象青龙也。 巳合乾坤借位中。 白虎自兹相见后， 白虎者铅，黄芽为之。 流朱那肯不相从。 流朱者，汞也。 性好飞走，得铅制之，不可走也。 欲识丹砂是木精，移来西位共金并。 丹砂是木精，合铅金，成大道。 凡人何处寻踪迹，恍惚之问在杳冥。 《老子》云：杳杳冥冥，其中有精。 恍恍惚惚，其中有物。 龙虎修来五转强，炉中渐觉菊花香。 言药鼎中如菊花香。 如今修炼正当节，莫恨悠悠日月长。 修炼运转，须看火候。 悟者由如返其路，迷徒不易寻踪苦。 悟者非难，迷人不易。 三人运合同一源，本性何曾离宗祖。 三人者，三物也，是水火金也。 一人本有一人无， 西方白虎为有，东方青龙为无。 金乡为妇木为夫。 金阴为妇也，木阳为夫也。 玄冥深奥不可度， 大道深玄，不可制度。

The *Can* states: It resembles the dust upon the bright window.
Lead and mercury belong to one gate, yet none may rely upon them;
The golden elixir’s secret teachings remain unknown even to sages.
This secret Dao of sages, none comprehend—
The world calls salt "sage," a mark of ignorance.

Do not take common gold and stone of the world,
To measure years and fire in vain contention.
If one uses worldly lead and mercury,
Refinement will yield no benefit.

Heaven births these things in response to emptiness and nothingness,
These things coalesce from subtle and wondrous radiance,
Not through artificial craft or forced creation.
As wife, as child, and again as husband—
This medicine is lord and minister, mother and child,
Husband and wife, fish and water.

The gate of the Three and Five lies only in the sun and moon,
Clearly, the positions of *mao* and *you* serve as the beginning.
If one knows the Three and Five, lifelong worries cease.
For *mao* and *you* are the stations of long life,
Where yang’s radiance is born and yin’s essence takes its seat.
Heaven and Earth cannot evade one another;
All matters ultimately return to the realm of Heaven and Earth.
Heaven and Earth are the great Dao,
Yet people use them daily without awareness.

After ten months of gestation, mother and child part,
But how could the wise ever abandon them?
When the cycle of transformation ends,
The refined numinous medicine stands alone,
The child dwelling apart while the mother is cast aside—
Thus, the wise never truly discard them.

Nurtured by nature’s endowment of purest truth,
The harmonious blackness coalesces into form.
The *Can* says: Heaven births the Dark Maiden,
Earth produces the Yellow Lad.
Wealth and nobility all stem from embracing the five hues,
How could lead and mercury ever be kin?

Mysterious and obscure, beyond all distinction—
People do not recognize lead and mercury.
The gate of lead and mercury’s meaning remains hard to reveal,
For people do not grasp the essence of yin and yang.
If the world cannot fathom its origin,
Examine the five phases closely, and you shall see for yourself.
The five phases are metal, wood, water, fire, and earth.
The infant, restless and elusive, cannot be grasped;
In vain, one wearies the spirit, suffering empty toil.
People fail to recognize the wondrous essentials,
Expending spirit in futility, seeing no effect.

But if one knows to heed the words of sages,
Clearly, this is the path to Heaven.
The Three and Five dwell together in one chamber—
The Dragon and Tiger are called the Three and Five.
One husband and two wives form a pair.
One and two are the numbers of water and fire; five is earth.
Only with a good matchmaker may they be joined,
Thus fostering intimate bonds of friendship.
The Way of yin and yang requires a good matchmaker,
The matchmaker being divine water.
With a good matchmaker, husband and wife naturally harmonize.

Yin and yang, obscure and unfathomable,
The Azure Dragon and White Tiger contend of themselves.
When the Dragon and Tiger enter the chamber, none can comprehend.
As the year draws to its end, transformations unfold in mutual devouring;
The White Tiger restrains the Dragon, and the Dragon gradually wanes.
At year’s end, the cycle completes—
Mercury is gradually congealed into treasure.

Heaven is yang, the old mother is Earth—
For one yin and one yang are called the Dao.
The Vermilion Bird of the south, the Dark Warrior of the north.
The south is the spirit of fire, the north the spirit of water.
As the years pass, all become earth—
Where then shall people seek the Dragon and Tiger?
Water and fire together become earth.

Three persons unite in shared purpose as one clan—
The three persons are the three legs of the tripod.
Ever revering the sun and moon shining within.
The two radiances of sun and moon enter the tripod and die.
Having encountered the Three Flowers, now they liquefy again;
Nine revolutions complete the work of years and months.
Nine revolutions mark the exhaustion of yang numbers,
The Three Flowers are fire.

The Azure Dragon’s essence lies in the east—
The east is *jia-yi* wood, mercury, the image of the Dragon in *zhen*.
It joins with Heaven and Earth, borrowing their positions.
After the White Tiger appears from this,
The White Tiger is lead, the Yellow Sprout its form.
How could flowing cinnabar refuse to follow?
Flowing cinnabar is mercury,
By nature fond of flying and fleeing—
Bound by lead, it cannot escape.

To know that cinnabar is the essence of wood,
Move it to the west to join with metal.
Cinnabar, the essence of wood, unites with leaden gold to complete the great Dao.
Where shall ordinary people seek its traces?
In the realm of the indistinct and obscure.
Laozi said: Dim and dark, within it lies essence;
Vague and elusive, within it lies substance.

When the Dragon and Tiger are refined through five revolutions,
Gradually, the fragrance of chrysanthemums arises in the furnace—
The medicine in the tripod emits a scent like chrysanthemums.
Now is the proper time for refinement;
Do not resent the long passage of days and months.
In refinement and circulation, one must observe the firing times.

Those who awaken return as if retracing their path,
While the lost find no easy way to seek its traces.
Awakening is not difficult; the lost struggle in vain.
Three persons move in harmony, sharing one source—
The three persons are the three substances: water, fire, and metal.
Their nature has never departed from the ancestral origin.

One person is, one person is not—
The White Tiger of the west is "is," the Azure Dragon of the east is "not."
Metal is the wife, wood the husband.
Metal is yin, the wife; wood is yang, the husband.
Profound and abstruse, beyond all measure—
The great Dao is deep and mysterious, beyond all systems.

chunks.original_text: 至事何曾肯画图。 保秘大道，不可画图明之。 天玄汪汪配地黄， 天玄地黄。 两精和合归洞房。 二熙俱入鼎中也。 白液炉中随月化， 随日月变化也。 时人服者莹心冻。 时人服之，能除万病。 金木相伤谁定源，乾坤运合自相连。 金克木，木生火，火能消金，相生相克，世人不了其根源也。 世上共藏阴大白，何人能解黄芽铅。 黄芽非世问所有，故人不测也。 十一月壬癸水位，以一阳生，反为阴大白。 至事元归在坎离， 言真水真火，是即黄芽，非世问水火。 世问铅汞莫相依。 若使世问几铅汞，误杀人。 贤者共藏人不见。 贤者能行持，故几人不可得见也。 淮王修炼金华池。 淮南王炼三十六水，能变化五金，尽为宝也。 九转铅精数欲终，开炉忽见药花红。 言大丹数终九转，其色红莲花也。 水火变来俱作土， 水火相持，自成灰土。 时人何处觅金公。 炼至九转，俱死成灰土，非正色也。 铅汞相传世所稀， 若遇灵丹，不可妄示非人。 太上科罚，七祖受罪。 丹砂玉质雪为衣。 丹砂色白，至士呼为秋石是也。 朝朝柢在君家舍，日日君看君不知。 世人日日见之，不知道源也。 还丹入口身自轻， 大丹入口，令人羽化身轻。 能除久病去妖精。 大丹入口，法三尸九虫，安和五藏六腑，无病所入也。 贪爱自兹无染着，能改愚人性与情。 大丹入口，令人不染恶疾，愚者变成贤人，与古仙齐名并躯矣。 沈浮恍惚性难辩，误取迷神年月远。 欲知灵药何日成，阴阳应须终九转。 谁料灵砂出世尘，三花合会虎龙亲。 君看前后炼丹者，侯杀千人与万人。 还丹歌诀卷下竟

The supreme work has never consented to be mapped in diagrams.
Guard the great Dao in secrecy—it cannot be made clear through illustrations.
Heaven’s profound mystery matches Earth’s yellow essence,
Heaven’s mystery and Earth’s yellow.
The two essences harmonize and return to the chamber of fusion.
The two breaths together enter the crucible.

In the furnace of white liquid, transformation follows the moon,
Changing with the waxing and waning of sun and moon.
Those who partake of it find their hearts clarified, as if frozen in purity.
Those who consume it can banish all illness.

Who can determine the source when metal and wood wound each other?
Heaven and Earth move in harmony, naturally interconnected.
Metal restrains wood, wood generates fire, fire melts metal—
Generation and restraint intertwine, yet the world fails to grasp their root.

The world conceals the great white of yin—
Who can comprehend the yellow sprout of lead?
The yellow sprout is not of this world, so none can fathom it.
In the eleventh month, when the water phase of *ren* and *gui* holds sway,
A single yang stirs, yet it is called the great white of yin.

The supreme work fundamentally resides in *kan* and *li*,
Speaking of true water and true fire—this is the yellow sprout,
Not the water and fire of the mundane world.
Mundane lead and mercury must not cling to each other—
If one employs the lead and mercury of this world, it will kill.

The wise conceal it where none can see.
The wise practice it in seclusion, so few ever witness it.
The King of Huai refined the golden flower in his pool,
The King of Huai concocted thirty-six waters,
Able to transform the five metals entirely into treasures.

When the nine cycles of lead essence near their end,
Opening the furnace, one suddenly beholds the red blossom of the elixir.
The nine revolutions of the great elixir complete, its hue is like the red lotus.

Water and fire transform together into earth,
Water and fire contend, naturally becoming ash and soil.
Where then can one seek the Golden Elder?
Refined to the ninth cycle, all perishes into ash and soil—this is not the true color.

The transmission of lead and mercury is rare in the world.
If one encounters the numinous elixir, it must not be recklessly shown to the unworthy—
The Most High’s statutes mete out punishment, and seven generations suffer the consequences.

Cinnabar’s jade-like substance wears a robe of snow,
The cinnabar is white, and the perfected call it "autumn stone."
Day after day it rests in your dwelling,
Yet day after day you gaze upon it without knowing its source.

When the returning elixir enters the mouth, the body becomes light,
The great elixir, once ingested, grants one the lightness of feathered transformation.
It can dispel long-standing illness and expel malevolent spirits,
The great elixir, upon entering the mouth, expels the Three Corpses and Nine Worms,
Harmonizing the five viscera and six bowels, leaving no room for disease.

From this point, greed and attachment fade away,
It can transform the foolish into the wise, altering their nature and emotions.
The foolish become sages, their names ranked alongside the ancient immortals.

Drifting and floating, indistinct—its nature is hard to discern,
Mistaking it leads the spirit astray, wasting years and months in vain.
To know when the numinous medicine will be complete,
Yin and yang must undergo nine full transformations.

Who could have foreseen that the numinous cinnabar would emerge from worldly dust?
The three flowers unite, and tiger and dragon become kin.
Behold those who have refined the elixir before and after—
How many thousands, even tens of thousands, have perished in the attempt?

The *Song of the Returning Elixir*, Scroll the Lower, concludes.
